model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Did you look for tickets to visit me?

MEMORY:
User Description:
Speaker B is a stereotypical old plumber who is balding and overweight. They have a short commute and live on the 32nd floor. Speaker B could eat eggs by the truckload and mentions warm days and cool mornings.

Relationship Description:
Speaker A recommends cheap flights to Anchorage for Speaker B and suggests getting blackout curtains for the "midnight sun" in Alaska. Speaker A reassures Speaker B about their trip and plans to make poached eggs for Speaker B every morning.

Event Description:
Speaker B plans on visiting Alaska in the summer to see the scenery and wildlife, including petting a wolf. They are interested in folk concerts and whale watching. Speaker A will take Speaker B on a tour with sleds pulled by dogs and will ensure Speaker B has a great time.
current_dialogue: Speaker A: Did you look for tickets to visit me?

raw_prediction: Speaker B: I'm glad to hear the weather is lovely there this week! I can't wait to experience the clear skies and sunshine myself. And I'm definitely looking forward to the folk music concert you mentioned. As for transportation, I think I'll be fine with walking or biking around. I could use the exercise after all those eggs!
